New Records: The Kansas City bullpen's scoreless streak reached 15 2/3 innings over four games, and the pitching staff's overall scoreless run extended to a franchise record 26 innings.
Key Match Events: Robbie Grossman hit a two-run single
Michael Massey singled in a run off DJ Herz
Daniel Lynch IV worked 2 2/3 scoreless frames in relief of Lorenzen
Angel Zerpa, John Schreiber, and Sam Long bridged the gap to Lucas Erceg, who completed his 13th save
Pre-Game Insights: The Royals manager Matt Quatraro emphasized the importance of throwing strikes and challenging hitters
Lorenzen was recalled from Triple-A Omaha on Aug. 26 and has not allowed a run in 10 relief appearances
Post-Match Reflections: Royals manager Matt Quatraro praised the bullpen's performance, saying 'When it's going Zerpa to Schrieber to Long to Erceg, I mean that's pretty nasty guys'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Royals held on to the second American League wild card with a 3-0 win over the Washington Nationals
Kansas City and Detroit are both 84-74 but the Royals hold the head-to-head tiebreaker advantage over the Tigers
